benchmark_details.name: DeepMath-Creative
benchmark_details.overview: DeepMath-Creative is a novel, high-quality benchmark comprising constructive mathematical problems aimed at evaluating the mathematical creativity of large language models (LLMs). The benchmark focuses on creative problem-solving across algebra, geometry, analysis, and other mathematical domains.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate the mathematical creativity of large language models and advance their mathematical proficiency.

data.source: Original problems designed and annotated by experts in the field of mathematics, derived from established professional mathematics textbooks.
data.annotation: Problems were meticulously designed and reviewed by professors and graduate students from the Department of Mathematics.

methodology.calculation: Scores are assigned based on accuracy of problem-solving direction and solution process, with manual grading by a team of mathematical experts for clarity and originality.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate a successful understanding of the problem and the ability to construct valid proofs or counterexamples.
methodology.baseline_results: Best-performing model achieved approximately 70% accuracy on basic undergraduate-level tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluation conducted using a standardized procedure with a uniform testing environment.
